column4: anyone knows a solution for this: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nautilus/+bug/17590/+viewstatus<------- it's been reported since 2005 and i have the same problem
guys?
does anyone know a solution for this: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nautilus/+bug/17590/+viewstatus<------- it's been reported since 2005 and i have the same problem
I wonder why the status is "invalid"
the status is invalid cos the guy who reported it didnt provide a crash stack to the gnome people, and it was more than a year ago
Maybe you should re-open it and give them a stacktrace then :)
im a noob i can barely install things if u help me i  will but i would like to find out if there's a solution so i dont open something just for nothing
What GFX card do you have?
im running Nvidia 6600 with nvidia closed drivers 100.14.19 installed by gutsy
Try turning it on in System -> Preferences -> Appearance
roger on that
i cant access that site for some reason
http://www.getswiftfox.org/
Try the .org I linked too, it gives valuable information about swiftfox ;)
so someone hacked the original site?
No, just domain squatted the .org, but this is the one time where I actually fully support someone domain squatting
I dont know, and I personally don't care, swiftfox violates the MPL and is probably not even much faster
ok lesson learned , do u know any way to control tracker?
Control in what way?
it's always there eating my processor
like 50%
